main event: A sighting of an unidentified flying object in Cedar Rapids, Iowa on September 8, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as clear and orange in color, shaped like a long, bright crafts without any sound,The sighting lasted for about three minutes before the object faded from view,The investigation suggested that the sighting could have been caused by a Beechcraft aircraft landing at a nearby airport,Investigators noted that the object's bright color may have been due to city lights,Comments from the investigating officer indicated skepticism toward the balloon theory, as no balloon or astronomical activity was recorded.
witness description: Steve Sedlacek, a 20-year-old photographer and CAA observer from Cedar Rapids.
